mercury.title: Mercury
mercury.desc: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun and is known for its extreme temperature variations, with scorching hot days and freezing nights.
mercury.tips: Protect against extreme heat with advanced cooling systems in your spacesuit.

points_of_interest.name: Caloris Basin
points_of_interest.desc: A large impact crater with intriguing geological features.

points_of_interest.name: Picasso Crater
points_of_interest.desc: Picasso is a crater on Mercury. It has drawn scientific attention because of the large, arc-shaped pit crater located on the eastern side of its floor. 44wq1

venus.title: Venus
venus.desc: Venus is often called Earth's sister planet due to its similar size and composition, but it has a thick, toxic atmosphere and a blistering surface temperature.
venus.tips: Use specially designed spacecraft to withstand the extreme heat and pressure.

points_of_interest.name: Ishtar Terra
points_of_interest.desc: A highland region with vast mountains and unique geological formations.

points_of_interest.name: Aphrodite Terra
points_of_interest.desc: Another prominent highland region,charaterized by its vast elevated plateaus and rugged terrain

Earth.title: Earth
Earth.desc: Earth is the only known planet to support life, with a diverse range of ecosystems, abundant water, and a hospitable climate.

points_of_interest.name: The Great Barrier Reef
points_of_interest.desc: The Great Barrier Reef in Australia for incredible marine life and coral reefs.

points_of_interest.name: Machu picchu,peru
points_of_interest.desc: This ancient incancitadel is nestled high in the Andes Mountains

Mars.title: Mars
Mars.desc: Mars, often referred to as the Red Planet is known for its reddish appearance and has been a target for exploration to search for signs of past or present life.
Mars.tips: Prepare for long-duration space travel and bring supplies for survival.

points_of_interest.name: Olympus Mons
points_of_interest.desc: The largest volcano in the solar system, with stunning views from its summit.

points_of_interest.name: Valles Marineris
points_of_interest.desc: The vast canyon system on mars,it stretches for over 2,500 miles and is up to 7 miles deep

Jupiter.title: Jupiter
Jupiter.desc: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system, known for its immense size and powerful storms, including the famous Great Red Spot.
Jupiter.tips: Stay far away from Jupiter's violent storms; visit its moons instead.

points_of_interest.name: Europa
points_of_interest.desc: Explore the subsurface ocean beneath its icy crust for signs of life.

points_of_interest.name: Ganymede
points_of_interest.desc: Ganymede is one of Jupiter's Galilean moons with a subsurface ocean

Saturn.title: Saturn
Saturn.desc: Saturn is recognized by its striking ring system, which consists of numerous icy and rocky particles encircling the planet.
Saturn.tips: Enjoy the view of Saturn's majestic rings from a safe distance

points_of_interest.name: Titan
points_of_interest.desc: Study its unique atmosphere and hydrocarbon lakes and rivers.

points_of_interest.name: Rings of saturn
points_of_interest.desc: Saturn is famous for its stunning ring system,which is composed of ice and rock particles

Uranus.title: Uranus
Uranus.desc: Uranus is a gas giant with a unique feature: it rotates on its side, making it appear to roll along its orbit.
Uranus.tips: Embrace the challenges of a remote study, as Neptune offers limited surface exploration possibilities.

points_of_interest.name: Miranda
points_of_interest.desc: The most heavily cratered moon with diverse geological features.

points_of_interest.name: Ring System
points_of_interest.desc: set of faint,narrow rings that encircle the planet

Neptune.title: Neptune
Neptune.desc: Neptune is the farthest known planet from the Sun and is characterized by its deep blue color and powerful winds, including the Great Dark Spot.
Neptune.tips: Embrace the challenges of a remote study, as Neptune offers limited surface exploration possibilities.

points_of_interest.name: Triton
points_of_interest.desc: Observe the geysers and unique nitrogen-ice terrain on this moon.

points_of_interest.name: Small Dark spot
points_of_interest.desc: The Small Dark Spot was found at a latitude of 54° South while rotating East around Neptune with a period of 16.1 hours
